    Modular Binary Set

    modular_binary_set.Rmd

    Notation

    Definition

    A modular binary set is basically an ordered set of all modular binary numbers within a given dimension. It is named “binary” because in the context of the haricot package we primarily work with the base-2 representation of numbers, and its size is defined as 2 to the power of its dimension. It is named “modular” because in the context of the haricot package, functions are defined with modular binary set ranges.

    Formal Definition

    Let the modular binary set dimension be a natural number greater than 0: \(d \in \mathbb{N}, d > 0\).
    A modular binary set of dimension \(d\), noted \(\mathbb{B}^{d}\), is defined as the Cartesian product \(B_{1} \times B_{2} \times ... \times B{d}\).

    Implementation

    This concept is implemented by the R6 class.

    #’ A modular binary domain of dimension is noted:. #’ #’ #’ #’ #’ @section Visual Representations: #’ Modular binary domains may be visually represented as vertical list of modular binary numbers. #’ The x axis (or columns) correspond to the respective bits of the module binary numbers: . #’ The y axis (or rows) correspond to the position of the modular binary number in the domain ordered by ascending order, that is equal to the integer value of that modular binary number. #’ {} #’ {} #’ {} #’ {} #’ {} #’ {} #’ #’ @section See also: #’ #’ #’ #’ @name modular_binary_domain #’ @family binaries NULL;

    summary(cars)
    ##      speed           dist       
##  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
##  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
##  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
##  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
##  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
##  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
